body_html:
Hmm, the docstring of assign_from_checkpoint_fn() states

  Returns:
    A function that takes a single argument, a `tf.Session`, that applies the
    assignment operation. If no matching variables were found in the checkpoint
    then `None` is returned.

whereas the Scaffold() expects init_fn to be

Optional function to use to initialize the model after running
    the init_op.  Will be called as `init_fn(scaffold, session)`.

Given this, both usages look invalid to me, and I'm not sure why the second one succeeded.

body:
Hmm, the docstring of `assign_from_checkpoint_fn()` states
```
  Returns:
    A function that takes a single argument, a `tf.Session`, that applies the
    assignment operation. If no matching variables were found in the checkpoint
    then `None` is returned.
```
whereas the `Scaffold()` expects `init_fn` to be
```
Optional function to use to initialize the model after running
    the init_op.  Will be called as `init_fn(scaffold, session)`.
```

Given this, both usages look invalid to me, and I'm not sure why the second one succeeded.
